data.title: Asymmetric Uncertainty: A Python package for handling nonstandard numerical uncertainties
data.name: asymmetric_uncertainty
data.description: A package that implements a class to represent numeric quantities with asymmetric uncertainties.

evidence: README mentions binaries/installers: "Otherwise, clone/download this repository, then (from a command line running within the associated directory) run `pip install .` or `python setup.py install`."
"This repository contains the `asymmetric_uncertainty` Python package, which provides the `a_u` class for dealing with these kinds of numbers in practice." (library-style class to be imported)
">>> from asymmetric_uncertainty import a_u" (intended to be imported as a dependency in other code)
